basic.floral_language:
Camellia spp.
Floriography: modest, cautious, lovely.
Camellia grijsii ranks the 7th in the top 10 Chinese traditional flowers. The camellia was popular with its graceful plant shape, green oval shaped leaves, bowl shape flowers, a variety of colors (pink, red, yellow, and multi-colors) and subtle elegant scent.
The camellia prefers partial shade. It is best grew in places with bright scatter light during summer and fall, could be moved under direct sunlight during winter. Blooming from October to next May for a duration of three to four weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period October-May, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.soil: Likes acidic soil, peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes half shade environments, put in a bright place in summer and autumn, full sunlight in winter
maintenance.watering: Not resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn, except flowering stages
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and yellowish leaves and withered flowers
